decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to play a high number of fast mana rituals and cantrips to fuel a storm count, then win the game with a Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam combo. The deck focuses on playing spells that generate mana and draw cards to build up a critical mass of spells before finishing off the opponent with a large Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam. It utilizes powerful discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own combo while digging for key pieces with cantrips like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, supported by cards like Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponents' game plans. It also includes utility lands such as Wasteland and Karakas to control the board and protect key threats. The inclusion of fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide allows for explosive plays, while the variety of Eldrazi creatures provide a mix of aggressive power and disruptive abilities to overwhelm opponents. The deck aims to quickly establish board dominance and pressure opponents into submission.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies while efficiently deploying threats like Mirran Crusader and Flickerwisp. Mother of Runes and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben help protect key creatures, while Aether Vial accelerates the board presence. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Phyrexian Revoker and Sanctum Prelate to control the game. With efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares and a strong equipment package, the deck aims to apply pressure and control the game tempo to secure victory in the aggressive Death & Taxes style.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat powerful and expensive creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield without paying their mana cost by using cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm, Cunning Wish, and Force of Will to protect the combo, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a massive threat early in the game. The deck also includes various card selection and manipulation spells like Ponder and Preordain to ensure consistency and smooth gameplay.

This deck aims to aggressively play Death's Shadow while using various tools such as Street Wraith, Brainstorm, and Ponder to quickly find and deploy threats. It also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and counterspells like Daze and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a small delve package with Gurmag Angler to provide additional threats. The inclusion of various removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember allows the deck to interact with the opponent's creatures while enabling its own aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on playing efficient threats and disruption spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. It utilizes powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to chip away at the opponent's life total while cards like Punishing Fire and Liliana of the Veil help disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to maintain a steady hand advantage with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach while using removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Lightning Bolt to handle threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan while also providing some utility with cards like Wasteland.

This deck focuses on aggressively deploying a variety of spirits while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The key strategy revolves around utilizing creatures with disruptive effects, such as Spell Queller and Spirit of the Labyrinth, to restrict the opponent's options. The deck also employs a tribal synergy with cards like Drogskol Captain and Supreme Phantom to boost the power of its spirit creatures. Additional disruption is provided through Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, while Aether Vial allows for quick deployment of creatures. The deck also features a few utility lands like Karakas and Moorland Haunt.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells and removal in order to establish a dominant board presence with powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic fetching equipment such as Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor adds another avenue of control for the player. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique for additional card advantage and disruption. Back to Basics and Council's Judgment provide further control options in specific situations.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt opponents' game plans using Chalice of the Void. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The inclusion of disruptive lands like Wasteland and Karakas further hinders opponents' strategies, while cards like Endbringer and Umezawa's Jitte provide additional versatility and power. Overall, the deck combines speed, disruption, and potent threats to dominate the game.

This deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently through burn spells and aggressive creatures. The main goal is to burn the opponent's life total as fast as possible while controlling the board with efficient removal spells. The deck also utilizes cards that punish opponents for playing nonbasic lands, further increasing the pressure on the opponent. With a low mana curve and high damage output, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on cheating in powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Emrakul, and Omniscience onto the battlefield quickly using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will, Flusterstorm, and Spell Pierce to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents. The mana base includes fast mana sources like Lotus Petal, Ancient Tomb, and City of Traitors to help cast the high-cost spells quickly. The goal of the deck is to overwhelm opponents with massive creatures and win the game quickly.

This deck aims to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler while disrupting opponents with efficient spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. By using cards like Street Wraith and Daze to manipulate life totals and protect threats, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and control. The mana base is streamlined to maximize consistency and speed, allowing the deck to apply pressure from the early turns of the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card manipulation. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gaining card advantage through cards like Ponder, Portent, and Predict. Using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and versatile creatures like Monastery Mentor and Snapcaster Mage, it can generate value over time and close out the game with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus. The inclusion of Back to Basics and Counterbalance further enhances its control over the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also aims to efficiently deploy threats like Stoneforge Mystic and True-Name Nemesis to pressure the opponent and close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Umezawa's Jitte allows for additional card advantage and powerful equipment to swing the game in the player's favor. By managing resources effectively and outmaneuvering the opponent, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Dark Depths combo to quickly create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It includes cards like Crop Rotation and Sylvan Scrying to tutor for Dark Depths, as well as ways to protect the combo with cards like Sylvan Safekeeper. Hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress help protect the combo from disruption, while cards like Abrupt Decay handle opposing threats. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and win the game through the powerful 20/20 token.

This deck focuses on the interaction between control elements and equipment cards to gain advantage and disrupt opponents' strategies. The main goal is to control the game by removing threats with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Council's Judgment while setting up card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage. Stoneforge Mystic is used to search for powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, which can quickly turn the tide of the game in favor of the player. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the game plan.
